commitResults.messageTitle: Completed Level-0. Renamed the chatbot to Mortal Reminder.
Updated the README to remove template information and replace it with my own placeholders.
Updated Level-0. Changed all non-main methods from static to non-static types.
Renamed ToDoList.java to Storage.java in occurrences and files.
Added a new line at the end of Task.java file.

commitResults.messageBody:
The list inside storage only stores Strings which are primitive structures.

Primitive Structures does not allow for complex representation of data which is what we eventually want to achieve with the Todos, Events and Deadlines in this project.

Thus, the list structure in the storage class needs to be modified and the accompanying methods also need to be fixed accordingly to allow a more complex data structure,  the Task class, to be stored in the list.

This allows each item inside the list to be packaged with both the task name and the mark status together in one object, and eventually we can extend this to other information we want to store together instead of separately.

The name storage should be reserved for dealing with loading and saving tasks in the file.

The current structure inside the file TaskList.java contains the task list itself and has operations to add/delete tasks in the list.

I will eventually separate the two but since this file already contains the tasklist itself, i will proceed to keep rename it as TaskList.java.

This will prevent further confusion in future and is more intuitive for the reader of this code to follow.

Regression testing manually is time consuming and laborious. This problem will only become more difficult to solve as the codebase increases in size.

I automated test scripts, expected input, expected output txt files were modified with relevant regression testing cases. I also updated the .sh file with the new name of the main file to allow the testing.

This will automate the testing process and save time.

I forsee the use of AI to autocomplete quite alot of methods which are similar to each other.

Many of the methods which I forsee creating are kind of repetitive and time consuming in the next few levels.

As such I have created AI.md to explain my rationale for using AI tools in a widespread manner and the explanations behind each use.

This will allow me to document my AI tools used concurrently with the progress of the project, to ensure adherence to the rules of the use of AI in the project.

There is many different parts of the code dealing with making sense of the user input.

This makes the debugging process and the code itself very messy.

In order to modulate the code better, I have created Parser.java to only handle all of the user input and change it to a state that the program can understand.

This will allow centralised handling of user inputs and better management of commands by the program.

I noticed the commands starting to become more and more complex.

More complex commands need to be represented by their own classes
to ensure the data is well modulated and communicated within the program
more efficiently.

Lets create a class to package command information together for easier storage
and communication and another class CommandExecutor to help execute such
commands instead of doing everything within the Parser class.

This ensures a cleaner code base, with all information referring to
commands and their executions within these files while the parser only handles
parsing user input. This will help with easier debugging due to better modularity.

I noticed the commands starting to become more and more complex.

More complex commands need to be represented by their own classes
to ensure the data is well modulated and communicated within the program
more efficiently.

Lets create a class to package command information together for easier storage
and communication and another class CommandExecutor to help execute such
commands instead of doing everything within the Parser class.

This ensures a cleaner code base, with all information referring to
commands and their executions within these files while the parser only handles
parsing user input. This will help with easier debugging due to better modularity.

# Conflicts:
#	src/main/java/Command.java
#	src/main/java/CommandExecutor.java

There is too many printing instances in many different files.

The formatting of the output is not always consistent and the handling of the printing is very messy for the coder.

Lets create a new printing class to handle all of the outputs from the chatbot. Ensure that the class is static so
that new instances will not have to be called and the printing can be done by invoking the class name only.

Using a static class to handle all the printing ensures that there is only one operation of printing
and multiple instances of printing does not occur within the program, leading to messy outputs.
It also makes it easier to use the printer anywhere without having to instantiate it leading to
cleaner code and debugging.

commitResults.messageTitle: Updated all files with new Format Print.
commitResults.messageBody:
All these files had some printing involved and were inconsistent in formatting.

Lets modify them to ensure consistent output generated by the chatbot by incorporating
the FormattedPrinting class.

The Task class has the common behaviour for all the different types
of items that can be found inside of the TaskList inside the chatbot.

However, it cannot capture all possible types of behaviours of the
many different types of tasks such as ToDos, Deadlines and Events
which all need to be configured differently.

Let's use polymorphism to extend the task class to these 3 different
classes. Let's change Task class to an abstract class with an abstract
method "getDesctiption" which is to be implemented differently by
each different type of Task. The constructor will also be shortened
to allow each type of Task to store the description differently.
Lastly, lets change the CommandExecutor file to call these different
types of tasks under each different types of commands.

Using polymorphism allows for the 3 different classes to have common
behaviours that do not need to be recoded at any minor change while
also be called using a common object type (Task) especially when we
are not sure what type of object will be returned. This also gives
us flexibility to change the behaviour of each class independently
from one another.

Changed the Constructor to include the description during
initialisation.

Long switch statement inside of Parser.java is not ideal.

It needs to be manually modified every time a new comment is added.
This means we are repeating the change every time we were to add a
new command both to the Enum List inside the CommandExecutor file
and the Parser file.

Lets create a separate Enum file to abstract out all the possible
commands and create a method inside Parser.java to search for the
command inside this Enum class.

Using enum's is preferable than a bunch of switch statements as it
reduces the amount of recoding necessary when new commands are
implemented and it also makes the code look cleaner to readers.

The program is not built to handle errors correctly.

This causes the program to crash if there is an input error by the
user, thus the program is not able to provide feedback to the user
about their input.

Let's add the following error handling functionality to the chatbot:
- marking/unmarking error: when the user tries to mark something
  that has already been marked/unmarked
- trying to view or mark items in an empty list
- adding a task without anything
- adding incorrect number of inputs for todo, deadline and events
  respectively.
- entering non-integers after mark/unmark
- marking/unmarking items out of the bounds of the list.

With the following error handling, the chatbot becomes more robust
and is able to provide useful feedback to the user about their input
so that the user is able to self correct their mistakes.

There is no way to delete tasks after you are done with them.

This makes the list look very messy after a few tasks have been
completed.

Let's create a delete functionality to allow users to delete tasks.

This will make the list easier to organise for the user, especially
if they have completed a task or added the task wrongly.

The amount of things to test per new function added is increasing.

This makes regression testing very laborious and time consuming.

Lets set-up semi automated testing using expected and input text
files to speed up the testing process.

This will make future testing quicker and less labour intensive.

Reformatted code to follow the code style required for CS2103 module
guidelines.

The list created inside of the CLI is only able to keep track of one
session and the list is destroyed after the session ends.

This makes the app useless unless the user keeps it open all the
time and if the app is deleted, the user loses all access to what
he/she has done.

Lets create a Storage class to enable long term storage and give the
user the power to decide when to delete tasks even after closing the
session.

Long term storage makes the app more robust in case of accidental
closing of the CLI app and eventually the real app.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add load and modify delete functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
The implementation of the long-term storage is incomplete due to
inability to load and delete properly from the long term storage
file.

This makes the app unable to access the information it has stored
and essentially be the same as before the long term storage.

Lets add load and delete from file functionality. Lets also add a
clear functionality to aid with the delete functionality.

The long term storage will now be completely accessible by the app
and be able to support memory between sessions.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Check if Storage Directory exists
commitResults.messageBody:
The program only checked if the file existed not the directory.

If the directory did not exist, the program would have thrown an
error on the first opening of the app itself.

Lets add a check to see if the directory exists when loading the app
at the start of every session.

This makes the system more robust on initial opening and even if the
directory was deleted by accident.

Minor fix to ensure runtest files working as intended after
implementing the check and create directory on top of file.
